customer_addr:
1250 South Collegeville Rd. UP3400
COLLEGEVILLE, PA 19426

citations.narrative:
On April 26, 2024 there was an incident in which 2 macaques were mistakenly placed into enclosures with access to each
other resulting in bite wounds. A scientist was returning a macaque to the enclosure after a procedure and a panel
allowing access to an adjacent enclosure with another macaque was inadvertently left open. The macaques began
fighting resulting in injuries to both animals. One macaque (ID # 150543) had deep wounds on the left shoulder and
smaller wounds on the forearm that required repair under anesthesia. The other macaque (ID # 161957) had 2 bite
wounds on the left arm and a laceration on the nose that required repair under sedation. Both animals were treated with
antibiotics and pain medications and recovered fully.
Failure to handle animals in a careful manner by allowing individually housed macaques contact with each other resulted
in significant injuries.
Handling of all animals must be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, physical harm, or
unnecessary discomfort.
Correct by: Corrected at the time of the incident by counseling of the employee. Continue to handle animals in a careful
manner from 4/7/25 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and IACUC representatives.
n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
On April 26, 2024 there was an incident in which 2 macaques were mistakenly placed into enclosures with access to each 
other resulting in bite wounds. A scientist was returning a macaque to the enclosure after a procedure and a panel 
allowing access to an adjacent enclosure with another macaque was inadvertently left open. The macaques began

antibiotics and pain medications and recovered fully. 
Failure to handle animals in a careful manner by allowing individually housed macaques contact with each other resulted 
in significant injuries. 
Handling of all animals must be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, physical harm, or 
unnecessary discomfort. 
Correct by: Corrected at the time of the incident by counseling of the employee. Continue to handle animals in a careful 
manner from 4/7/25 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and IACUC representatives.
